definition[0]: to make someone feel extremely tired
example[0]: A full day’s teaching exhausts me.
example[1]: He’d exhausted himself carrying all the boxes upstairs.
example[2]: We are in danger of exhausting the world’s oil supply.
example[3]: Having exhausted all other possibilities, I asked Jan to look after the baby.
definition[2]: a pipe on a car or machine that waste gases pass through
definition[3]: the gas produced when an engine is working
definition[4]: if you exhaust a supply of something, you use it all, so that there is none left
example[5]: The museum was unable to buy the painting as its funds were exhausted by the purchase of two huge albums of eighteenth-century architectural drawings.
definition[5]: to take all the natural supplies of something from a place such as a mine so that there is none left
example[6]: Cut-and-run logging is expected to exhaust the primary rainforest by the end of the decade.
